feed.title: Tamouse’s Recipe File
feed.subtitle: This is a collection of my personal and favourite recipes, collected over the years in various places.

entry.title: Mushroom Quiche with Sweet Potato Crust

link.title: Mushroom Quiche with Sweet Potato Crust

entry.summary: Sweet potatoes make the perfect gluten-free crust for this custardy quiche. Brown the mushrooms with garlic to deepen their meaty flavor. This can easily be turned dairy free using vegan milk and cheese.

entry.title: Garlic-Herb Burst Tomatoes
entry.summary: These make an excellent condiment for all sorts of things.

entry.title: Beef Stroganoff with Zucchini Zoodles
entry.summary: Inspired on a night when I had a bunch of stew beef thawed, and some zucchini zoodles thawed, and was trying to think what to do with them together. Took me a couple minutes, then came up with this.

entry.title: Instant Pot Spare Ribs
entry.summary: This was a great recipe to start with, and I've added my own twists to it

entry.title: Grilled Italian Sausage with peppers, onions, and cheese

link.title: Grilled Italian Sausage with peppers, onions, and cheese

entry.summary: I found this way to make these deliious italian sausages on tiktok; I can't remember the creator, but she has a lot of great recipes, tips, and ideas.

entry.title: Keto Bites
entry.summary: I saw this recipe on tiktok, forgot to write down the originator. It took me several passes of the video to get everything written down, as they were also talking fast to make it fit in under 60 seconds. I haven't tried these yet, but they sound pretty good to me.

entry.title: BBQ rub
entry.content:
Ingredients

  • 1 tablespoon brown sugar
  • 2 teaspoons sea salt or kosher salt
  • 2 teaspoons onion powder
  • 2 teaspoons chili powder
  • 2 teaspoons ground mustard
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons smoked paprika
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
  • 3/4 teaspoon ground cumin
  • 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper

Directions

  1. Combine all ingredients in a small bowl.

  2. Prepare meat, remove excess fat, remove membranes, etc.

  3. Lightly smear the surfaces with mustard to act as a binder.

  4. Spread the rub on all surfaces, pressing into the meat well.

  5. Let the rub sit for a while so it works its way into the meat.

  6. Cook meat as you will.

Notes

I used this rub for ribs I cooked in the Instant Pot, and they came out amazing.
entry.summary: Ingredients 1 tablespoon brown sugar 2 teaspoons sea salt or kosher salt 2 teaspoons onion powder 2 teaspoons chili powder 2 teaspoons ground mustard 1 1/2 teaspoons smoked paprika 1 teaspoon dried thyme 1 teaspoon dried oregano 1 teaspoon garlic powder 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper 3/4 teaspoon ground cumin 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper

entry.title: Marinara Sauce (simple)
entry.summary: A very simple way to make marinara sauce that tastes better than jarred.

entry.title: Sweet Potato Lasagna, with meat
entry.summary: The idea for this was taken from a vegan lasagna recipe, but the concept is wonderful as a gluten-free and dairy-free option for a meat-based lasagna.

entry.title: Shrimp (or Prawns) Over Pasta In Tomato Cream Sauce - Redux

link.title: Shrimp (or Prawns) Over Pasta In Tomato Cream Sauce - Redux

entry.content:
Redone to make this gluten-free and dairy-free

Shallots, garlic, wine, tomatoes, and cream make a fabulous fresh sauce for prawns (or shrimp) and pasta. It is paired with angel hair pasta here, but feel free to use your favorite pasta.

Have all your ingredients chopped and ready to go because this dish only takes about 15 minutes to cook from start to finish.

Recipe reduced from original for 2 servings.

Ingredients:

  • 1 Tablespoon olive oil
  • 2 shallots, minced (or 1/3 cup minced sweet onion)
  • 4 cloves of crushed garlic (or 2 tablespoons of bottled crushed garlic)
  • 1/2 cup red wine
  • 3 Roma tomatoes (this is the only kind I will buy from the store) or 1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes (drained), chopped
  • 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano (crushed to release flavor)
  • 1/4 teaspoon dried basil
  • 1/2 cup almond or oat milk
  • 1/2 pound large raw prawns (10-12 count), peeled and deveined
  • 1 Tablespoon chopped fresh basil
  • 1/8 cup cashew parmesean “cheese” (e.g. “Nooch It!”)
  • Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
  • gluten-free long (spaghetti) pasta, cooked al dente
  • Additional chopped fresh parsley for garnish (optional)

Directions:

  1. Heat a large heavy skillet over medium heat.

  2. Add olive oil and sauté shallots or onions for 5 minutes.

  3. Add garlic and sauté another 2 minutes.

  4. Carefully pour in red wine and cook another minute, stirring constantly.

  5. Add chopped tomatoes, oregano, and basil, stirring to combine. Simmer about 5 minutes for flavors to blend.

  6. Slowly add almond or oat milk to tomato mixture, stirring while it goes in.

  7. Continue cooking until reduced and somewhat thickened.

  8. Add shrimp or prawns and basil to tomato cream sauce and simmer, turning often, only until pink and opaque. (Do not overcook or they will become tough.)

  9. Stir in cashew parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper to taste. Serve immediately over cooked pasta.

As mentioned above, you can use sun-dried tomatoes in this instead of fresh Roma tomatoes. Don’t use any other kind of tomatoes unless you grow them yourself or get them from someone who does. Supermarket tomatoes (even the organics) are grown to be shipped and have virtually no flavour.

update So, in a pinch, I’ve used canned tomatoes for this, and it works just fine, so no need to be so strict, really.
entry.summary: Redone to make this gluten-free and dairy-free
